section.name: Getting Started
section.p: This small guide will get you up and running with Plexus as fast as possible. It is assumed that:

ul.li: You have a JDK installed on your machine.
You have Maven installed on your machine.

subsection.name: Checking out the Plexus sources
subsection.p: Execute the following commands to check out the sources for the Plexus container, the Plexus components and the Plexus Maven plug-in:

Now all you need to do is run the getting-started script for your given platform. This will execute the standard 'getting-started' that Maven projects tend to provide in order to get new users up and running quickly. Unfortunately we must use native scripts at the moment due to some quirks with Maven's reactor. After you have executed this script you will have everything you need on your machine to start your first Plexus application.

subsection.name: Using the Plexus Maven plug-in
subsection.p: The Plexus Maven plug-in will help you to develop your Plexus application by doing the following:

ul.li: Provide goals to help generate Plexus components.
Provide goals to help generate Plexus component tests.
Provide goals to help assemble a Plexus application runtime.

subsection.p: In order to use the Plexus Maven plug-in you must install so that it is registered with Maven. You can either build the plug-in your self from sources or you may just download the plug-in from here.
